rules.natural: Provided that an engineer approves the chemical process, it is not the case that the chemical process is safe.
Whenever the sensors are accurate, calibration is not needed for the sensors.
Either the temperature is rising in the reactor or the coolant is active in the reactor.
Under the condition that the coolant is active in the reactor, pressure is not stable in the reactor.
If a safety protocol is engaged for the reactor, then an alarm sounds for the reactor.

If a shift lead is present in the control room and it is not the case that if the temperature is rising in the reactor then pressure is not stable in the reactor, then a safety protocol is engaged for the reactor.
Either a shift lead is present in the control room or a senior engineer is present in the control room.

If a senior engineer is present in the control room and it is not the case that if the temperature is rising in the reactor then pressure is not stable in the reactor, then a safety protocol is engaged for the reactor.
Whenever an audit is scheduled for the process, if management is reviewing the data then a report is submitted for the data.
If compliance is verified for the process, then an audit is scheduled for the process.
If a regulator is notified about the process, then whenever an investigation is ordered for the process, a permit is revoked for the process.
Provided that a media inquiry is received about the incident, either a public announcement is made about the incident or an incident occurred at the plant.

Either a safety board is reviewing the incident or an external audit is conducted for the incident.
Under the condition that an external audit is conducted for the incident, findings are published about the incident.

Provided that findings are published about the incident, if it is not the case that if an engineer approves the chemical process then the chemical process is efficient, then the chemical process is not optimized.
Provided that maintenance is scheduled for the chemical process, an inspection is complete for the chemical process.
Whenever repairs are completed for the chemical process, a shutdown is initiated for the chemical process.
If a maintenance lead approves the chemical process, then if an inspection is complete for the chemical process, repairs are completed for the chemical process.
Either a maintenance lead approves the chemical process or a chief engineer approves the chemical process.

If an emergency shutdown occurs for the chemical process, then a shutdown is initiated for the chemical process.
Provided that a system backup is complete for the control panel, if a log is updated for the control panel then if an operator monitors the control panel, readings are normal on the control panel.
If a sensor malfunction occurs for the sensors, then an operator does not monitor the control panel.
Either a sensor malfunction occurs for the sensors or a connection is lost for the sensors.
